mltgeneration
  • Reference

Wrapper to initialize variables for qx iteration process

Iterate scalar values to find ideal scalars to apply to age-specific qx or mx values, to better-match target 5q0 and 45q15 values Target values are generally HIV-free or with-HIV 5q0 and 45q15 calculated from entry simulations, with scaled HIV CDRs applied to them Initialize required variables for select_scalars function and the HIV adjustment functions called within. After scalars are selected, apply the best scalars to the final values to generate final age-specific adjusted values.

qx_iterations(current_lt, target_qx, hiv_type = "", scalar_set_max = 0.06,
  scalar_set_min = 1e-04, num_iterations = 30, num_scalars = 11, by_vars,
  age_group)

Arguments

current_lt

data.table with age-specific qx or mx values, along with aggregate 5q0 and 45q15 For stage 1, should contain standard LT qx; for stage 2, should contain mx values (if non-ZAF, HIV-free; if ZAF, with-HIV)
target_qx

data.table with calculated aggregate 5q0 and 45q15 qx values that iteration should attempt to match to.
hiv_type

character, options: "hiv_free", "with_hiv", "hiv_free_ZAF", "with_hiv_ZAF"
scalar_set_max

numeric, the initial upper value of scalars to be tested
scalar_set_min

numeric, the initial lower value of scalars to be tested
num_iterations

numeric whole number, the maximum number of times the function will test different ranges of scalars
num_scalars

numeric whole number, the number of scalar values to be tested within each iteration
by_vars

character vector, the variables within stan_qx and hiv_free_qx group by
age_group

character. Options: "5q0" or "45q15"

Value

a data table with by_vars, best_scalar, target_5q0, target_45q15. Includes qx if stage 1, mx and ax if stage 2.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
